703845f.text:
Court Street (backgground), at Livingston Street, showing an excavation for the Chamber of Commerce Building at the N.W. corner (foreground). Also shown are the N.E. and S.E. corners. This is a set of two, showing
the positive and negative views.
October 12, 1924.
Albert A. Volk Company.
703845f.folder: Court Street & Livingston Street, Brooklyn, NY

703846f.text:
Court Street, west side, at Livingston Street, showing in the foreground at the N.W. corner an excavation conducted by Albert A. Volk Company. On this site is to be erected the Chamber of Commerce Building. This is a set of two, consisting of a positive and negative
view.
October 12, 1926.
Albert A. Volk Company.
703846f.folder: Court Street & Livingston Street, Brooklyn, NY

703847f-a.text:
78 Court Street, at the S.W. corner of Livingston Street. In this corner building, was housed the First High School of Brooklyn.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
703847f-a.folder: Court Street & Livingston Street, Brooklyn, NY

705480f-a.text:
94 Livingston Street, south side, between Court Street and Boeruw Place,
showing a view of the Brooklyn Eye and Ear Hospital.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
705480f-a.folder: Livingston Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

703848f-a.text:
93 Court Street, east side, between Livingston and State Stree s.
About 1932.

705479f.text:
Livingston Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Court Street, showing partial demolition carried on by Albert A. Volk and Company. The Chamber of Commerce Building now (1937) occupies the site. In the right background is seen a section of the Municipal Building. Note the 4-story building (No. 67) still stands. At the left, partially seen, is the 6-story Livingston Court Building. This
set consists of a negative and positive view.
June 25, 1926.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.
705479f.folder: Livingston Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
